questions.answer: Drops the pudding / smashes a bowl

questions.answer: His mom's overnight bag with wallet, purse, and dead phone

questions.text: What object has Finn's mom turned into a time-traveling portal?
Who is believed to be the only ones who can time travel in Finn's family that Finn later proves wrong by being able to time travel also?
questions.answer: It is believed only women in Finn's family can time travel- his grandma, aunts, mom, and sister

questions.text: Finn finds a note in his pocket where there was a shopping list from his Gran that says what?
questions.answer: I was wrong. Don't trust anyone.

questions.text: What is the name and profession of Gran's boyfriend?
questions.answer: Doc Lovell- he is a doctor

questions.text: How does Finn explain what a "peakbagger" is?
questions.answer: Hikers who want to "bag"/climb every peak

questions.answer: A rotting animal skull of some kind

questions.text: What are the "markers" or "landing points" called that Finn's mom explains are needed for time travel but are being closed off one by one?

questions.answer: A silver skeleton key or "key ring"

questions.text: When Finn meets her for the last time, who says, "What I'm trying to tell you is, it's not the data, it's the people. It's the choices they makeâ€”choices to be kind, choices to see and not look away. Those are the real factors. That's what tilts the equation. It has never been the beat of a butterfly wing, it's the beat of a human heart."?

is it believed there are multiple timelines and multiple universes?
are only the females in the family believed to be able to time travel until Finn proves them wrong?
does the main character's grandma write a note he finds after her death, warning him not to trust anyone?

does a girl drown in a quarry only for the reader to discover that she is not really dead later in the book?
